1.brief: a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.)
to cut or carve (wood, stone or other material); by implication, to hew, split, square, quarry, engrave
a column (as standing); also a stand, i.e. platform
seven (as the sacred full one); also (adverbially) seven times; by implication, a week; by extension, an indefinite number

2.brief: properly, something slaughtered; hence, a beast (or meat, as butchered); abstractly butchery (or concretely, a place of slaughter)
meaning accession (used as an adverb or conjunction); also or yea; adversatively though
to set in a row, i.e. arrange, put in order (in a very wide variety of applications)
a table (as spread out); by implication, a meal

3.brief: to send away, for, or out (in a great variety of applications)
to call out to (i.e. properly, address by name, but used in a wide variety of applications)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
the back; by extension the body or self
altitude, i.e. concretely (an elevated place), abstractly (elevation, figuratively (elation), or adverbially (aloft)

4.brief: who? (occasionally, by a peculiar idiom, of things); also (indefinitely) whoever; often used in oblique construction with prefix or suffix
hither or thither (but used both of place and time)
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything

5.brief: to walk (literally or figuratively); causatively, to carry (in various senses)
to feed on; figuratively, to consume; by implication, to battle (as destruction)
food (for man or beast), especially bread, or grain (for making it)

6.brief: to loosen, i.e. relinquish, permit, etc.
to live, whether literally or figuratively; causatively, to revive
to be straight (used in the widest sense, especially to be level, right, happy); figuratively, to go forward, be honest, proper
a road (as trodden); figuratively, a course of life or mode of action, often adverb

7.brief: to chastise, literally (with blows) or figuratively (with words); hence, to instruct
properly, to make mouths at, i.e. to scoff; hence (from the effort to pronounce a foreign language) to interpret, or (generally) intercede
to take (in the widest variety of applications)
to be right (i.e. correct); reciprocal, to argue; causatively, to decide, justify or convict
morally wrong; concretely, an (actively) bad person
to stain; a blemish (physically or morally)

8.brief: not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
to be right (i.e. correct); reciprocal, to argue; causatively, to decide, justify or convict
properly, to make mouths at, i.e. to scoff; hence (from the effort to pronounce a foreign language) to interpret, or (generally) intercede
properly, removal; used only (in the construction) adverb as conjunction, lest
to be right (i.e. correct); reciprocal, to argue; causatively, to decide, justify or convict
to have affection for (sexually or otherwise)

9.brief: to give, used with greatest latitude of application (put, make, etc.)
to be wise (in mind, word or act)
properly, iteration or continuance; used only adverbially (with or without preposition), again, repeatedly, still, more

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)
to add or augment (often adverbial, to continue to do a thing)
properly, something received, i.e. (mentally) instruction (whether on the part of the teacher or hearer); also (in an active and sinister sense) inveiglement

10.brief: fear (also used as infinitive); morally, reverence
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
sacred (ceremonially or morally); (as noun) God (by eminence), an angel, a saint, a sanctuary

11.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
to add or augment (often adverbial, to continue to do a thing)
a year (as a revolution of time)
alive; hence, raw (flesh); fresh (plant, water, year), strong; also (as noun, especially in the feminine singular and masculine plural) life (or living thing), whether literally or figuratively

12.brief: used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
to be wise (in mind, word or act)
to be wise (in mind, word or act)
properly, to make mouths at, i.e. to scoff; hence (from the effort to pronounce a foreign language) to interpret, or (generally) intercede
properly, separation; by implication, a part of the body, branch of atree, bar forcarrying; figuratively, chief of a city; especially (with prepositional prefix) as an adverb, apart, only, besides
to lift, in a great variety of applications, literal and figurative, absolute and relative

13.brief: to make a loud sound (like English 'hum'); by implication, to be in great commotion or tumult, to rage, war, moan, clamor
properly, a failure; by implication nothing; usually (adverb) not at all; also lest

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)

properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses

14.brief: properly, to sit down (specifically as judge. in ambush, in quiet); by implication, to dwell, to remain; causatively, to settle, to marry
an opening (literally), i.e. door (gate) or entrance way
a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
properly, covered, i.e. a throne (as canopied)
altitude, i.e. concretely (an elevated place), abstractly (elevation, figuratively (elation), or adverbially (aloft)

15.brief: to call out to (i.e. properly, address by name, but used in a wide variety of applications)
to cross over; used very widely of any transition (literal or figurative; transitive, intransitive, intensive, causative); specifically, to cover (in copulation)
a road (as trodden); figuratively, a course of life or mode of action, often adverb
to be straight or even; figuratively, to be (causatively, to make) right, pleasant, prosperous
a well-trodden road (literally or figuratively); also a caravan

16.brief: who? (occasionally, by a peculiar idiom, of things); also (indefinitely) whoever; often used in oblique construction with prefix or suffix
hither or thither (but used both of place and time)
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything

17.brief: water; figuratively, juice; by euphemism, urine, semen
to thieve (literally or figuratively); by implication, to deceive
to suck, by implication, to relish, or (intransitively) be sweet
food (for man or beast), especially bread, or grain (for making it)
a cover (in a good or a bad, a literal or a figurative sense)

18.brief: not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
properly, lax, i.e. (figuratively) a ghost (as dead; in plural only)
there (transferring to time) then; often thither, or thence
Hades or the world of the dead (as if a subterranean retreat), including its accessories and inmates
to call out to (i.e. properly, address by name, but used in a wide variety of applications)
